| author = Sebastian TrÃ¼g | developer = [[KDE]] | released = | latest release version = 2.0.2 | latest release date = {{release date and age|2011|01|15}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = [[C++]] ([[Qt (framework)|Qt]]){{cite web |url=http://www.ohloh.net/p/k3b |title=Ohloh Analysis Summary - K3b |publisher=[[Ohloh]] |archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate=2010-05-14 }} | operating system = [[Unix-like]] | platform = [[KDE Platform]] | genre = [[Optical disc authoring]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]] 2{{cite web |url=http://websvn.kde.org/trunk/extragear/multimedia/k3b/COPYING?view=markup |title=K3b sources - COPYING |publisher=websvn.kde.org |archiveurl= |archivedate= |accessdate=2010-05-14 }} | website = [http://k3b.org/ k3b.org] }} '''K3b''' (from '''KDE Burn Baby Burn'''){{cite web |url=http://dot.kde.org/2006/04/17/k3b-fundraiser-2006-complete-success |title=K[4]B? |accessdate=2009-03-11}} is a [[Compact Disc|CD]] and [[DVD]] [[optical disc authoring|authoring]] application by [[KDE]] for [[Unix-like]] computer [[operating system]]s. It provides a [[graphical user interface]] to perform most CD/DVD burning tasks like creating an Audio CD from a set of audio files or copying a CD/DVD, as well as more advanced tasks such as burning eMoviX CD/DVDs. It can also perform direct disc-to-disc copies. The program has many default settings which can be customized by more experienced users. The actual disc [[CD recorder|recording]] in K3b is done by the [[command line interface|command line]] utilities [[cdrecord]] or [[cdrkit]], [[cdrdao]], and [[growisofs]]. As of version 1.0, K3b features a built-in [[Ripping|DVD ripper]]. As is the case with most KDE applications, K3b is written in the [[C++]] [[programming language]] and uses the [[Qt (framework)|Qt GUI toolkit]].{{cite web |url=http://kde.org/whatiskde/devview.php |title=Developer's View |accessdate=2007-03-20 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070202191430/http://www.kde.org/whatiskde/devview.php |archivedate = 2007-02-02}}{{cite web |url=http://developer.kde.org/language-bindings/ |title=Language bindings |accessdate=2007-03-20}} Released under the [[GNU General Public License]], K3b is [[free software]]. A first alpha of a [[KDE Platform|KDE Platform 4]] version of K3b was released on 22 April 2009, the second on 27 May 2009 and a third on 14 October 2009.{{cite web| url=http://k3b.org/ |title=Project home page announcement |accessdate=2009-05-18}}{{cite web |url=http://blog.mandriva.com/2009/03/19/mandriva-helps-porting-k3b-in-qt4/ |title=Mandriva helps porting K3b in Qt4 |accessdate=2009-03-24}}{{cite web |url=http://trueg.wordpress.com/2009/03/23/intermission-why-i-needed-to-fork-qprocess-for-k3b/ |title=Intermission: Why I Needed To Fork QProcess For K3b |accessdate=2009-03-23}} K3b is a software project that was started in 1998, and is one of the mainstays of the KDE desktop. == Features == Some of K3b's main features include: * Data CD/DVD burning * Audio CD burning * [[CD Text]] support * [[Bluray]]{{cite web |url=http://www.k3b.org/ |title=K3b 2.0 released |accessdate=2010-08-15}}/[[DVD-R]]/[[DVD+R]]/[[DVD-RW]]/[[DVD+RW]] support * [[CD-R]]/[[CD-RW]] support * [[Mixed Mode CD]] (Audio and Data on one disk) * Multisession CD * [[Video CD]]/[[Video DVD]] authoring * [[eMovix]] CD/[[eMovix]] DVD * Disk-to-disk CD and DVD copying * Erasing CD-RW/DVD-RW/DVD+RW * [[ISO image]] support * Ripping Audio CDs, Video CDs, Video DVDs K3b can also burn data CDs that support Linux/Unix based OS, Windows, DOS, [[Universal Disk Format|Very Large Files (UDF)]], Linux/Unix + Windows, [[Rock Ridge]], and [[Joliet (file system)|Joliet]] file systems. K3b's full list of features (the below list could be still incomplete): * Creating data cds: :- Add files and folders to your data cd project via drag'n'drop. :- Remove files from your project, move files within your project. :- Create empty direcories within your project. :- Write data cds on-the-fly directly without an image file or with image file. It's also possible to just create the image file and write it to cd later. :- [[Rock Ridge|Rockridge]] and [[Joliet file system]] support. :- Rename files in your project. :- Let K3b rename all the [[mp3]]/[[ogg]] files you add to your project to a common format like "artist - title.mp3". :- For advanced users: support for nearly all the [[mkisofs]] options. :- Verifying the burned data. :- Support for multible [[El Torito (CD-ROM standard)|El-Torito]] boot images. :- Multisession support * Creating audio cds: :- Pluggable audio decoding. Plugins for [[WAV]], MP3, [[FLAC]], and Ogg Vorbis are included. :- [[CD-TEXT]] support. Will automagically be filled in from tags in audio files. :- Write audio cds on-the-fly without decoding audio files to wav before. :- Normalize volume levels before writing. :- Cut audio tracks at the beginning and the end. * Creating Video CDs: :- VCD 1.1, 2.0, [[SVCD]] :- CD-i support (Version 4) - Creating mixed-mode CDs: :- CD-Extra (CD-Plus, Enhanced Audio CD) support. :- All data and audio project features. * Creating eMovix CDs * CD Copy :- Copy single and multi session data CDs :- Copy Audio CDs :- Copy Enhanced Audio CDs (CD-Extra) :- Copy CD-Text :- Add CD-Text from cddb :- CD Cloning mode for perfect single session CD copies * DVD burning: :- Support for DVD-R(W) and DVD+R(W) :- Creating data DVD projects :- Creating eMovix DVDs :- Formatting DVD-RWs and DVD+RWs * CD Ripping: :- CDDB support via http, cddbp and local cddb directory. :- Sophisticated pattern system to automatically organize the ripped tracks in directories and name them according to album, title, artist, and track number. :- CD-TEXT reading. May be used instead of CDDB info. :- K3b stores CDDB info of the ripped tracks which will automatically be used as CD-TEXT when adding the ripped files to an audio project. :- Plugin system to allow encoding to virtually every audio format. Plugins to encode to Ogg Vorbis, Mp3, FLAC, and all formats supported by SoX included. * DVD Ripping and DivX/XviD encoding * Save/load projects. * Blanking of CDR-Ws. * Retrieving Table of contents and cdr information. * Writing existing iso images to CD or DVD with optional verification of the written data. * Writing cue/bin files created for CDRWIN * DVD copy (no video transcoding yet) * Enhanced CD device handling: :- Detection of max. writing and reading speed. :- Detection of Burnfree and Justlink support. :- Good media detection and optional automatic CD-RW and DVD-RW blanking * KParts-Plugin ready. == See also == {{Portal|Free software}} * [[List of optical disc authoring software]] * [[Brasero (software)|Brasero]], a [[GTK+]] optical disc authoring program. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.k3b.org/ K3b website] * [http://userbase.kde.org/K3b The K3b Handbook] * [http://kde-look.org/index.php?xcontentmode=63&PHPSESSID=5aaef4c33165c8f3a099a9512a36bec2 K3b Themes] {{KDE}} {{Optical disc image software}} {{Disk image emulators software}} [[Category:KDE Extragear]] [[Category:Free CD writing software]] [[Category:Optical disc authoring software]] [[Category:Linux CD/DVD writing software]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]] [[Category:Linux CD ripping software]] [[ar:Ù3Ø¨]] [[ast:K3b]] [[bar:K3b]] [[bg:K3b]] [[ca:K3b]] [[cs:K3b]] [[de:K3b]] [[es:K3b]] [[eu:K3b]] [[fr:K3b]] [[ko:K3b]] [[it:K3b]] [[lt:K3b]] [[hu:K3b]] [[nl:K3b]] [[ja:K3b]] [[no:K3b]] [[pl:K3b]] [[pt:K3b]] [[ro:K3b]] [[ru:K3b]] [[sk:K3b]] [[sl:K3b]] [[fi:K3b]] [[sv:K3b]] [[tr:K3b]] [[uk:K3b]] [[zh:K3b]]
